question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration. Help me create a birthday card frontend program for my 85-year-old mother who was a teacher, accompanied by classic Western oldies music.

checklist.title: Is the birthday card visual design age-appropriate and teacher-themed?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements a visually appealing birthday card with teacher-themed elements (books, apples, classroom motifs, etc.) and age-appropriate design for an 85-year-old recipient. Check for large, readable fonts (minimum 18px), high contrast colors, and meaningful educational symbols. Score 0 if no thematic elements are present, 5 if basic birthday card layout exists, and 10 if fully themed with teacher-specific decorations and age-appropriate considerations.

checklist.title: Is the classic Western oldies music integration properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the HTML5 audio implementation includes proper music controls, autoplay handling (with user interaction compliance), and features classic Western oldies tracks suitable for an 85-year-old. Verify volume controls, play/pause functionality, and track selection. Deduct 5 points if music doesn't autoplay after user interaction, 3 points if volume controls are missing, and 5 points if music selection isn't age-appropriate. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are interactive birthday card animations and effects well-designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the card includes engaging but gentle animations suitable for elderly users - such as falling confetti, blooming flowers, or gentle fade-in effects for birthday messages. Animations should be smooth, not overwhelming, and enhance the emotional impact. Deduct 5 points if animations are too fast or jarring, 3 points if no interactive elements exist, and 5 points if effects don't match the celebratory theme. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the personalized message system and content delivery implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes a personalized birthday message system with heartfelt content appropriate for a retired teacher. Verify if messages appear progressively, include teaching appreciation themes, and have options for customization. Deduct 5 points if messages are generic, 3 points if no progressive reveal mechanism exists, and 5 points if content doesn't reflect the teacher profession. Give 10 points if fully personalized with teaching-related appreciation messages.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as audio loading failures, browser compatibility issues, slow network connections, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that enhance emotional connection?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes thoughtful features that enhance the emotional experience (e.g., 1. Photo slideshow integration 2. Voice message recording capability 3. Memory timeline of teaching career 4. Interactive guest book for family messages). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple audio players) 2. Function modules unrelated to birthday celebration (e.g., games or complex navigation) 3. Overly flashy effects that might overwhelm elderly users (e.g., rapid blinking animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core birthday card functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating audio/visual/interaction layers), clean HTML structure, and organized CSS/JavaScript. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or no design patterns are used; deduct 5 points if code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if files are not properly organized. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet accessibility and aesthetic standards for elderly users?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design follows accessibility principles for elderly users: 1) High contrast color combinations with warm, nostalgic tones 2) Large, clear typography (minimum 18px, preferably 20px+) 3) Generous spacing and large clickable areas 4) Consistent visual hierarchy. Deduct 3 points for each small or hard-to-read element, 5 points for poor color contrast, and 5 points for cluttered layout. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the user interaction gentle and intuitive for elderly users?
checklist.description: Judge whether interactions are designed for elderly users: 1) Large, clearly labeled buttons with hover effects 2) Gentle, slow-paced animations (500-800ms duration) 3) Clear visual feedback for all interactions 4) Simple, intuitive navigation flow. Deduct 5 points for each small or unclear interactive element, 3 points for too-fast animations, and 5 points for confusing navigation. Full score is 10 points.
